snippet: BP agreed with the lawyers for businesses and individuals affected by the 2010 oil spill to pay $7.8 billion in claims, but the federal government, the largest plaintiff, was not a party to the settlement.
abstract: BP comes to a settlement agreement with lawyers for plaintiffs in the trial over the 2010 oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico; company estimates that paying the claims will cost $7.8 billion, in addition to $8 billion already paid; agreement does not include payments to federal, state and local governments, who are also suing.

byline.contributor: Clifford Krauss and Charlie Savage contributed reporting

lead_paragraph: BP agreed with the lawyers for businesses and individuals affected by the 2010 oil spill to pay $7.8 billion in claims, but the federal government, the largest plaintiff, was not a party to the settlement.

headline.main: Accord Reached Settling Lawsuit Over BP Oil Spill
